title: Yin-Yang: LLM vs Knowledge Graph
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
Artificial Intelligence
Data Management
Knowledge Graphs
Large Language Models
description: An interactive visualization using the Yin-Yang symbol to illustrate the complementary characteristics of Large Language Models and Enterprise Knowledge Graphs.

learningObjectives: Understand the fundamental differences between Large Language Models and Knowledge Graphs
Recognize the complementary nature of these two technologies
Identify appropriate use cases for each technology
Analyze how these technologies can work together in enterprise applications
Evaluate the strengths and limitations of each approach
prerequisites: Basic understanding of databases and data structures
Familiarity with AI and machine learning concepts
Understanding of structured vs unstructured data

accessibility: Screen reader support via describe() function

variables: yangText: Title for Large Language Model
Product_B_Features: Array of Knowledge Graph characteristics
assumptions: The Yin-Yang symbol effectively represents complementary opposites
Five key characteristics capture the essence of each technology
limitations: Static visualization without interactive parameter changes
Does not show how the technologies can integrate
